segment.source: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V
segment.target: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V

segment.source: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V
segment.target: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V

segment.source: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V
segment.target: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V

segment.source: Before you can deliver a MED-V workspace to users, you have to first prepare a virtual hard disk that you use to build the MED-V workspace installer package for Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.
segment.target: Before you can deliver a MED-V workspace to users, you have to first prepare a virtual hard disk that you use to build the MED-V workspace installer package for Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.

segment.source: To prepare the necessary virtual hard disk, you must create a Windows Virtual PC image that contains the required operating system, updates, and software to let you later deploy applications and URL redirection information to users.
segment.target: To prepare the necessary virtual hard disk, you must create a Windows Virtual PC image that contains the required operating system, updates, and software to let you later deploy applications and URL redirection information to users.

segment.source: This section provides guidance about how to create the virtual hard disk.
segment.target: This section provides guidance about how to create the virtual hard disk.

segment.source: To create a virtual image for MED-V, you must follow these steps.
segment.target: To create a virtual image for MED-V, you must follow these steps.

segment.source: Create a Windows Virtual PC image
segment.target: Create a Windows Virtual PC image

segment.source: Install Windows XP on the image
segment.target: Install Windows XP on the image

segment.source: Install the .NET Framework on the image
segment.target: Install the .NET Framework on the image

segment.source: Apply updates to the image
segment.target: Apply updates to the image

segment.source: Install Integration Components
segment.target: Install Integration Components

segment.source: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image
segment.target: Creating a Windows Virtual PC Image

segment.source: To create a Windows Virtual PC image, see the Windows Virtual PC documentation:
segment.target: To create a Windows Virtual PC image, see the Windows Virtual PC documentation:

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC Home Page (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=148103).
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC Home Page (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=148103).

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC Help (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=182378).
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC Help (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=182378).

segment.source: Alternately, if you already have a Windows Imaging (WIM) file that you want to use as the basis for your virtual image, you can convert it to a VHD that you use to build the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Alternately, if you already have a Windows Imaging (WIM) file that you want to use as the basis for your virtual image, you can convert it to a VHD that you use to build the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: For more information about how to convert a WIM to a virtual hard disk, see Native VHD Support in Windows 7 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195922).
segment.target: For more information about how to convert a WIM to a virtual hard disk, see Native VHD Support in Windows 7 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195922).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: MED-V only supports one virtual hard disk per virtual machine and only one partition on each virtual disk.
segment.target: MED-V only supports one virtual hard disk per virtual machine and only one partition on each virtual disk.

segment.source: After you have created your virtual hard disk, install Windows XP on the image.
segment.target: After you have created your virtual hard disk, install Windows XP on the image.

segment.source: Installing Windows XP on a Windows Virtual PC Image
segment.target: Installing Windows XP on a Windows Virtual PC Image

segment.source: MED-V requires that Windows XP SP3 is installed on the Windows Virtual PC image before you build the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: MED-V requires that Windows XP SP3 is installed on the Windows Virtual PC image before you build the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: For more information about how to install Windows XP, see Create a virtual machine and install a guest operating system (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=182379).
segment.target: For more information about how to install Windows XP, see Create a virtual machine and install a guest operating system (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=182379).

segment.source: Installing the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 on a Windows Virtual PC Image
segment.target: Installing the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 on a Windows Virtual PC Image

segment.source: You must manually install the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 and the update KB959209 into the Windows Virtual PC image that you prepare for use with MED-V.
segment.target: You must manually install the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 and the update KB959209 into the Windows Virtual PC image that you prepare for use with MED-V.

segment.source: The update KB959209 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=204950) addresses several known application compatibility issues.
segment.target: The update KB959209 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=204950) addresses several known application compatibility issues.

segment.source: Applying Updates to the Windows Virtual PC Image
segment.target: Applying Updates to the Windows Virtual PC Image

segment.source: After you have installed Windows XP on your virtual machine, install any required Windows XP updates on the image, such as SP3.
segment.target: After you have installed Windows XP on your virtual machine, install any required Windows XP updates on the image, such as SP3.

segment.source: You can also install certain optional updates for better performance.
segment.target: You can also install certain optional updates for better performance.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: MED-V requires that Windows XP SP3 be running on the guest operating system.
segment.target: MED-V requires that Windows XP SP3 be running on the guest operating system.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: When you install updates to Windows XP, make sure that you remain on the version of Internet Explorer in the guest that you intend to use in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: When you install updates to Windows XP, make sure that you remain on the version of Internet Explorer in the guest that you intend to use in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: For example, if you intend to run Internet Explorer 6 in the MED-V workspace, make sure that any updates that you install now do not include Internet Explorer 7 or Internet Explorer 8.
segment.target: For example, if you intend to run Internet Explorer 6 in the MED-V workspace, make sure that any updates that you install now do not include Internet Explorer 7 or Internet Explorer 8.

segment.source: In addition, we recommend that you configure the registry to prevent automatic updates from upgrading Internet Explorer.
segment.target: In addition, we recommend that you configure the registry to prevent automatic updates from upgrading Internet Explorer.

segment.source: Installing an Optional Performance Update
segment.target: Installing an Optional Performance Update

segment.source: Although it is optional, we recommend that you install the following update for hotfix KB972435 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201077).
segment.target: Although it is optional, we recommend that you install the following update for hotfix KB972435 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201077).

segment.source: This update increases the performance of shared folders in a Terminal Services session:
segment.target: This update increases the performance of shared folders in a Terminal Services session:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The update is publically available.
segment.target: The update is publically available.

segment.source: However, you might be prompted to accept an agreement for Microsoft Services.
segment.target: However, you might be prompted to accept an agreement for Microsoft Services.

segment.source: Follow the prompts on the successive webpages to retrieve this hotfix.
segment.target: Follow the prompts on the successive webpages to retrieve this hotfix.

segment.source: Configuring a Group Policy Performance Update
segment.target: Configuring a Group Policy Performance Update

segment.source: By default, Group Policy is downloaded to a computer one byte at a time.
segment.target: By default, Group Policy is downloaded to a computer one byte at a time.

segment.source: This causes delays while MED-V is being joined to the domain.
segment.target: This causes delays while MED-V is being joined to the domain.

segment.source: To increase the performance of Group Policy, set the following registry key value to the registry:
segment.target: To increase the performance of Group Policy, set the following registry key value to the registry:

segment.source: Registry subkey: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinlogon
segment.target: Registry subkey: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinlogon

segment.source: Entry: BufferPolicyReads
segment.target: Entry: BufferPolicyReads

segment.source: Type: DWORD
segment.target: Type: DWORD

segment.source: Value: 1
segment.target: Value: 1

segment.source: Installing Integration Components
segment.target: Installing Integration Components

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC includes the Integration Components package.
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC includes the Integration Components package.

segment.source: This provides features that improve the interaction between the virtual environment and the physical computer.
segment.target: This provides features that improve the interaction between the virtual environment and the physical computer.

segment.source: For example, the Integration Components package lets your mouse move between the host and the guest computers.
segment.target: For example, the Integration Components package lets your mouse move between the host and the guest computers.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: MED-V requires the installation of the Integration Components package.
segment.target: MED-V requires the installation of the Integration Components package.

segment.source: When you configure the virtual image to work with MED-V, you must manually install the Integration Components package on the guest operating system to make the integration features that are available.
segment.target: When you configure the virtual image to work with MED-V, you must manually install the Integration Components package on the guest operating system to make the integration features that are available.

segment.source: For more information about how to install and use the Integration Components package, see the following:
segment.target: For more information about how to install and use the Integration Components package, see the following:

segment.source: Install or Upgrade the Integration Components Package (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195923).
segment.target: Install or Upgrade the Integration Components Package (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195923).

segment.source: About Integration Features (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195924).
segment.target: About Integration Features (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195924).

segment.source: Installing RemoteApp Update
segment.target: Installing RemoteApp Update

segment.source: After you install the Integration Components package, you are prompted to install the following update: "Update for Windows XP SP3 to enable RemoteApp."
segment.target: After you install the Integration Components package, you are prompted to install the following update: "Update for Windows XP SP3 to enable RemoteApp."

segment.source: This is a required component for MED-V.
segment.target: This is a required component for MED-V.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are not prompted to install the RemoteApp update, you must download and install it manually.
segment.target: If you are not prompted to install the RemoteApp update, you must download and install it manually.

segment.source: For more information and instructions about how to download this update, see Update for Windows XP SP3 to enable RemoteApp (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195925).
segment.target: For more information and instructions about how to download this update, see Update for Windows XP SP3 to enable RemoteApp (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195925).

segment.source: Enabling Remote Desktop
segment.target: Enabling Remote Desktop

segment.source: By default, Remote Desktop is enabled after you install the Integration Components package.
segment.target: By default, Remote Desktop is enabled after you install the Integration Components package.

segment.source: For MED-V to be operational, ensure that Remote Desktop is enabled, and do not distribute any Group Policy that disables it.
segment.target: For MED-V to be operational, ensure that Remote Desktop is enabled, and do not distribute any Group Policy that disables it.

segment.source: For information about how to enable Remote Desktop, see Enable or disable Remote Desktop (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201162).
segment.target: For information about how to enable Remote Desktop, see Enable or disable Remote Desktop (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201162).

segment.source: Customizing Internet Explorer by Using the Internet Explorer Administration Kit
segment.target: Customizing Internet Explorer by Using the Internet Explorer Administration Kit

segment.source: If you want, you can use the Internet Explorer Administration Kit to customize Internet Explorer on the guest operating system.
segment.target: If you want, you can use the Internet Explorer Administration Kit to customize Internet Explorer on the guest operating system.

segment.source: For more information, see the Internet Explorer 6 Administration Kit and Deployment Guide (http:// go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200007).
segment.target: For more information, see the Internet Explorer 6 Administration Kit and Deployment Guide (http:// go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200007).

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: You should consider security concerns associated with customizing Internet Explorer in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: You should consider security concerns associated with customizing Internet Explorer in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: For more information, see Security Best Practices for MED-V Operations.
segment.target: For more information, see Security Best Practices for MED-V Operations.

segment.source: After your virtual hard disk is installed with an up-to-date guest operating system, you can install applications on the image.
segment.target: After your virtual hard disk is installed with an up-to-date guest operating system, you can install applications on the image.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Installing Applications on a Windows Virtual PC Image
segment.target: Installing Applications on a Windows Virtual PC Image

segment.target: Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V
